resources.string: Length is defined as the straight-line distance between two points along an object. The SI unit of length is the meter.
Area is the quantity that expresses the extent of a two-dimensional figure or shape, or planar lamina. The SI unit of area is Sq Metre.
The weight of an object is the force of gravity on the object and may be defined as the mass times the acceleration of gravity. Since the weight is a force, its SI unit is the newton.
